ch.aplu.android

Class GGTouch

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.aplu.android.GGTouch

  • public class GGTouch
extends java.lang.Object
    Singleton class used to report screen touch events. Touch events are not restricted to the visible playground, but coordinates are reported in pixel coordinates relative to the upper-left vertex of the game grid.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int click
      Pressed and released in a quick sequence.
      static int doubleClick
      Pressed, released, pressed, released in a quick sequence.
      static int drag
      Pressed followed by a move (for touch listeners, press must be inside touch area)
      static int idle
      No touch event occured.
      static int longPress
      Pressed a long time.
      static int press
      Screen pressed (touched).
      static int release
      Screen released.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static GGTouch create()
      Creates a GGTouch instance with default values for the instance variables.
      static GGTouch create(GGTouchListener listener, int evt, int x, int y)
      Creates a GGTouch instance with given values for the instance variables.
      int getEvent()
      Retrieves the current event type as integer.
      java.lang.String getEventType()
      Returns the event type as string.
      GGTouchListener getSource()
      Retrieves the GGTouchListener reference that created the event.
      int getX()
      Retrieves the current x-coordinate of the touch position with respect to the upper left vertex of the visible area in pixels.
      int getY()
      Retrieves the current y-coordinate of the touch position with respect to the upper left vertex of the visible area in pixels.

    • Field Detail

      • idle

        public static final int idle
        No touch event occured.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • press

        public static final int press
        Screen pressed (touched).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • release

        public static final int release
        Screen released. Also happens pressed inside and then dragged out of the playground or out of touch area (for touch listeners).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • click

        public static final int click
        Pressed and released in a quick sequence.
        Press, release, click are generated in this order.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • doubleClick

        public static final int doubleClick
        Pressed, released, pressed, released in a quick sequence.
        Press, release, click, double-click is generated in this order.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • drag

        public static final int drag
        Pressed followed by a move (for touch listeners, press must be inside touch area)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • longPress

        public static final int longPress
        Pressed a long time.
        Press, longPress is generated in this order
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static GGTouch create()
        Creates a GGTouch instance with default values for the instance variables.

      • create

        public static GGTouch create(GGTouchListener listener,
             int evt,
             int x,
             int y)
        Creates a GGTouch instance with given values for the instance variables.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener instances that created the event
        evt - the event type (an or-combination of the predefined constants)
        x - the x-coordinate where the event occurred (pixel coordinates relative to the upper-left vertext of the game grid)
        y - the y-coordinate where the event occurred (pixel coordinates relative to the upper-left vertext of the game grid)
        Returns:
        a GGTouch instance reference

      • getSource

        public GGTouchListener getSource()
        Retrieves the GGTouchListener reference that created the event.
        Returns:
        a reference to the GGTouchListener that created the event

      • getEvent

        public int getEvent()
        Retrieves the current event type as integer.
        Returns:
        one of the predefined constants

      • getX

        public int getX()
        Retrieves the current x-coordinate of the touch position with respect to the upper left vertex of the visible area in pixels.
        Returns:
        x-coordinate (pixel index) where the event occured

      • getY

        public int getY()
        Retrieves the current y-coordinate of the touch position with respect to the upper left vertex of the visible area in pixels.
        Returns:
        y-coordinate (pixel index) where the event occured

      • getEventType

        public java.lang.String getEventType()
        Returns the event type as string.
        Returns:
        the event type
